content.name: replicationSession
content.description:
Information about replication sessions.

Replication is a process in which storage data is duplicated either locally or to a remote network device. Replication produces a read-only, point-in-time copy of source data and periodically updates the copy, keeping it consistent with the source data. Replication provides an enhanced level of redundancy in case the main storage backup system fails. As a result, the:
  • Downtime associated cost of a system failure is minimized.
  • Recovery process from a natural or human-caused disaster is facilitated.
A replication session establishes an end-to-end path for a replication operation between a source and a destination. The replication source and destination may be local or remote. The session establishes the path that the data follows as it moves from source to destination.

attributes.name: srcResourceId
attributes.description: Identifier of the source resource in the replication session.

attributes.name: dstStatus
attributes.description: Status of the destination end of the replication session.

attributes.name: localRole
attributes.description: Role of the local system in the replication session.

attributes.name: dstResourceId
attributes.description: Identifier of the destination resource.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the replicationSession instance.

attributes.name: dailySnapReplicationPolicy
attributes.description: Daily Snap Replication Policy

attributes.name: currentTransferEstRemainTime
attributes.description: Estimated time left for the replication synchronization to complete.

attributes.name: hourlySnapReplicationPolicy
attributes.description: Hourly Snap Replication Policy

attributes.name: remoteSystem
attributes.description: The remote system to which this replication session is connected, as defined by the remoteSystem resource type.

attributes.name: syncState
attributes.description: Synchronization state between source and destination resource of the replication session.

attributes.name: maxTimeOutOfSync
attributes.description: Maximum time to wait before the system syncs the source and destination  resources. Value of -1 specifies that automatic sync is not performed.

attributes.name: dstSPBInterface
attributes.description: SP B interface used on the destination system for the replication, if the  replication session is a remote session.

attributes.name: syncProgress
attributes.description: Synchronization completion percentage between source and destination        resources of the replication session.

attributes.name: srcStatus
attributes.description: Status of the source end of the session.

attributes.name: dstSPAInterface
attributes.description: SP A interface used on the destination system for the replication,  if the  replication session is a remote session.

attributes.name: srcSPBInterface
attributes.description: SP B interface used on the source system for the replication, if the  replication session is a remote session.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: Replication status of the replication session.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: User-specified replication session name.

attributes.name: networkStatus
attributes.description: Status of the network connection used by the replication session.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: Health information for the replication session, as defined by the health  resource type.

attributes.name: members
attributes.description: Information about the replication of each member lun in the group.

attributes.name: replicationResourceType
attributes.description: Replication resource type of replication session endpoints.

attributes.name: lastSyncTime
attributes.description: Date and time of the last replication synchronization.

attributes.name: srcSPAInterface
attributes.description: SP A interface used on the source system for the replication, if the  replication session is a remote session.
